Course Name: ACG 3341 - MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING THEORY AND PRACTICE
Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES A SURVEY OF THE THEORY AND APPLICATION OF MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES. TOPICS INCLUDE COST BEHAVIORS, PRODUCTION COSTING METHODS, DATA PROCESSING, ECONOMIC ANALYSIS, BUDGETING, AND MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL CONTROL.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.IDENTIFY THE VARIOUS TYPES OF COSTS, THEIR BEHAVIORS, AND THEIR IMPACT ON DECISIONS AFFECTING BUSINESS OPERATIONS 
2.DEMONSTRATE HOW TO USE VARIOUS TYPES OF COSTING METHODS TO IMPROVE THE SUCCESSFUL OPERATION OF A BUSINESS
3.UNDERSTAND COST-VOLUME-PROFIT RELATIONSHIPS AND THEIR IMPORTANCE TO BREAKEVEN ANALYSIS
4.DEVELOP BUDGETS AND EXPLAIN HOW THEY CAN BE USED AS PLANNING AND PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT TOOLS
Textbook(s):
